<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/31/biden-releases-23-trillion-infrastructure-plan-boost-us-competitiveness-combat-climate-change?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Bridges and Tunnels and Ports, Oh My!
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/31/biden-releases-23-trillion-infrastructure-plan-boost-us-competitiveness-combat-climate-change" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="1 train in NYC" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83ODEvMV90cmFpbl9pbl9ueWMuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/User:Mtattrain" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Mtattrain</a>, <a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:MTA_NYC_Subway_1_trains_at_125th_St.jpg" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">MTA NYC Subway 1 trains at 125th St</a>, <a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/legalcode" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY-SA 4.0</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What 7-Eleven did to fountain soda, President Biden wants to do to US infrastructure.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Biden laid out his Big Gulp idea: a <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-03-30/biden-to-lay-out-u-s-economic-renewal-in-rejuvenated-pittsburgh?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$2.3 trillion plan</a> to revamp the country’s roads, bridges, trains, schools, housing, electric grid, and lots more. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Btw, not sure if we mentioned this but the plan is large: The administration said it’d be the biggest federal investment program since Eisenhower’s interstate highway system of the late 1950s and the Space Race of the 1960s. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The details </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Four-part plans like these are what bullet points were made for:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>$620 billion for transportation projects such as transit, roads, airports, and more. That also includes $174 billion for electric vehicles. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>$650 billion to improve your life at home, like investments in high-speed broadband and the electric grid.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>$580 billion for manufacturing, because we know how much the supply chain needs support.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>$400 billion to caregiving efforts for the elderly and those with disabilities.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Given the size of the bill, the WH can’t just put its card down and Venmo everyone later. To help pay for it, Biden wants to bump up the corporate tax from 21% to 28% and close other tax loopholes.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But that’s not good enough for many Republicans, who slammed the bill as a “<a href="https://apnews.com/article/joe-biden-technology-coronavirus-pandemic-pittsburgh-jen-psaki-8865ffc8f5ad3142155a5bd3c3a3e6d3?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Trojan horse</a>” for tax hikes.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So why do it? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Biden sees this plan as addressing two malarkies in particular: the climate crisis and the growing ambitions of autocratic China.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>For the climate, the plan “would be the most far-reaching federal investment to date in programs that would help curb greenhouse gas emissions,” </span><span><a href="https://www.axios.com/biden-climate-transit-package-d9c8ffad-4486-4e61-a7bb-3d421fa0546d.html?utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=editorial&utm_content=energy-environment-infrastructure&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes Axios</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Investments in semiconductor production and other cutting-edge research are intended to match China’s burgeoning tech muscles. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>this is DC, after all, so gear up for a nasty legislative fight over the spring.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead reprise...</strong>Biden will introduce Part 2 of his economic spending proposal in the next few weeks, called the American Family Plan. This one will focus on “social infrastructure,” including childcare relief and aid to low-income Americans.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CIVIL RIGHTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/31/72-black-executives-join-fight-protect-voting?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
“There Is No Middle Ground”
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/31/72-black-executives-join-fight-protect-voting" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="ATLANTA, GA - DECEMBER 14: Voters line up for the first day of early vot..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NTc5L2Vhcmx5X3ZvdGluZ19zdGFydHNfaW5fZ2UuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Jessica Mcgowan/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Kenneth Chenault, former CEO of American Express, and Kenneth Frazier, CEO of pharma giant Merck, <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/31/business/voting-rights-georgia-corporations.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spearheaded</a> a letter signed by 72 Black executives to oppose restrictive voting bills across the US, specifically the one <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/georgia-voting-restrictions/2021/03/25/91009e72-8da1-11eb-9423-04079921c915_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">passed</a> in Georgia last Thursday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Some context: </strong>After some Republican lawmakers alleged voter fraud during the 2020 election, bills like Georgia’s have been popping up in state and local legislatures. 250+ new voting laws have been proposed in at least 43 states, per the Brennan Center for Justice. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Critics like Chenault and Frazier warn that the proposals could make it harder for Black, Latino, and other minority populations to vote. The letter encourages corporations to speak out against the bills and use their resources to oppose them.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Civil rights activists took specific aim at Georgia-based companies that they felt were staying too quiet. Following protests and calls for a boycott, the CEOs of both Coca-Cola and Delta said they oppose the state’s new legislation.  </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“The entire rationale for this bill was based on a lie,” Delta boss Ed Bastian wrote in an internal memo.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Companies that proclaimed Black Lives Matter last summer are now under pressure to deliver on their statements.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CANNABIS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/31/new-york-becomes-15th-state-legalize-marijuana?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Nuggedaboutit
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sean Paul said “legalize it” and New York lawmakers replied, “We be burnin’.” Yesterday, NY Gov. Andrew Cuomo <a href="https://patch.com/new-york/new-york-city/recreational-marijuana-ny-only-needs-cuomos-signature?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">signed legislation</a> legalizing the recreational use of marijuana by adults, making New York the 15th state to do so. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Two takeaways from NY’s Marijuana Regulation and Taxation Act</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1. All marijuana convictions that would not have occurred had this law existed are now expunged, or wiped from offenders’ records. It’s part one in New York’s attempt to repair, or at least throw some duct tape on, the War on Drugs’s legacy. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>40% of all cannabis-generated tax revenue will be </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/31/nyregion/cuomo-ny-legal-weed.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reinvested</a></span><span> into minority communities.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2. The bill has provisions in place to keep the Medmens of the world from dominating mom-and-pop marijuana operations. One of those rules: Half of all marijuana business licenses will be granted to “social equity applicants,” such as minority- and woman-owned companies.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>New York’s cannabis economy is expected to become the second-biggest US market (just after Cali), generating billions in sales and $350 million in annual tax revenue once it fully lights up. But you just have to cross the Holland Tunnel into New Jersey to see <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/22/nyregion/new-jersey-marijuana-legalization.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">it’ll be a while</a> before you can buy a nug at your local bodega.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">

<img alt="JobsOhio" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvMjIwNi8xNjE2MTAyOTAyLUpPX0ludGVyY2VwdF9Nb3JuaW5nYnJld18xNTAweDg1MF9Jbm5vdmF0aW9uLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6ImNvbWV0LW1vcm5pbmdicmV3IiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Did you know there are 48 states that aren’t California and New York? And did you know one of those states is <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N9515.3407870MORNINGBREW0/B25142222.299497138;dc_trk_aid=492124076;dc_trk_cid=138232885;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=;gdpr=%24{GDPR};gdpr_consent=%24{GDPR_CONSENT_755};ltd=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Ohio</a>—and that they’re doing big things in the tech and innovation space?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As the state that ranks <strong style="color:#000">5th in venture capital growth</strong>, it features <strong style="color:#000">3 cities that are in the Top Ten Tech Markets</strong> in the US. So basically, if you’re a 1s and 0s person, <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N9515.3407870MORNINGBREW0/B25142222.299497138;dc_trk_aid=492124076;dc_trk_cid=138232885;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=;gdpr=%24{GDPR};gdpr_consent=%24{GDPR_CONSENT_755};ltd=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Ohio should be on your short list</a> of places to take your business game to the next level.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You want more reasons to high-five Ohio? Here:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Ohio has created Innovation Districts and dedicated developments across the state to accelerate research, develop STEM employees, and attract top-tier talent (like you).</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Ohio invests in their workforce, upskilling incumbent workers and reskilling workers for the jobs of the future.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Ohio’s also got 7 pro sports teams, 70 state parks, and numerous halls of fame. Just saying.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So if you’re looking to advance your career or grow your business, <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N9515.3407870MORNINGBREW0/B25142222.299497138;dc_trk_aid=492124076;dc_trk_cid=138232885;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=;gdpr=%24{GDPR};gdpr_consent=%24{GDPR_CONSENT_755};ltd=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">check out all things Ohio right here</a>.</p>
</td>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/31/key-performance-indicators-april-1?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>US producers made <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/corrugated-boxes-have-never-been-in-more-demandor-more-expensive-11617189646?mod=hp_lead_pos6&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">3.4% more cardboard</a> in 2020 than the previous year due to higher demand for shipping boxes. Might not sound like a lot, but that increase is equivalent to 477 square miles of corrugated board, enough to cover all of New York City with room to spare.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote:  </strong>“The intention was to generate awareness of an important corporate and industry issue in the country. We regret that the announcement rollout may have upset some people.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">VW <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/43ec8ac6-2f8c-472d-a505-b48b82361497?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">apologized</a> for its horribly timed April Fools’ joke earlier this week, when it announced that it was changing the name of its US unit to “Voltswagen.” Time to put this story to bed...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>When did people start working out? (<a href="https://melmagazine.com/en-us/story/when-did-people-start-working-out?utm_source=nextdraft&utm_medium=email&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">MEL Magazine</a>)</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
DELIVERY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/03/31/deliveroo-underdelivers-stock-market-debut?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A Soggy IPO
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Apparently, not all IPOs “pop.” UK delivery startup Deliveroo <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/deliveroo-shares-plunge-in-market-debut-11617180583?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">went public</a> on the London Stock Exchange Wednesday, and by the close of trading, the Amazon-backed company’s shares fell nearly 26%.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Why the under-delivery?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a market more crowded than a Chicken Nacho Cheese Chalupa, investors have started to wonder how delivery services can pull a profit. The consensus: Even with orders way up during the pandemic, they don’t. Deliveroo raked in roughly $1.7 billion in net revenue last year, but lost $312 million.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Across the pond, Uber Eats, GrubHub, and DoorDash all continue to dish out more money than they make, too.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The only ones <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/22/no-winners-delivery-app-food-fight?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">winning</a> in this hypercompetitive market? Users who know their way around a SUMMER20 promo code, and definitely not restaurants—which are charged up to 35% on some Deliveroo orders. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the path to profits for delivery companies could get a lot steeper. Following a landmark court ruling, Uber recently said its UK drivers will receive a minimum wage and benefits, a concession that could set a precedent for the rest of the gig economy. </p>

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">April Fools’ Day or not, we’re always down to trick you with some weird headlines. Three of these are real, one is not. Can you guess which is the fake?</p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Researchers </span><span><a href="https://thehill.com/blogs/blog-briefing-room/news/544768-researchers-produce-nose-only-covid-19-masks-to-wear-while?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">produce</a></span><span> nose-only COVID-19 masks to wear while eating or drinking”</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Man </span><span><a href="https://media.giphy.com/media/u0HHneVR9Z2YE/giphy.gif?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sells</a></span><span> NFT of ‘Dunkaroos’ growing frog legs and exploding for $500”</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“British swan won't stop </span><span><a href="https://www.cbc.ca/radio/asithappens/as-it-happens-thursday-edition-1.5963864/this-british-swan-won-t-stop-knocking-on-people-s-doors-for-hours-on-end-1.5963971?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">knocking</a></span><span> on people's doors for hours on end”</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Mafia fugitive </span><span><a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-56563182?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">caught</a></span><span><span> after posting cooking show on YouTube”</span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ol>
</td>
</tr>

soda, President Biden wants to do to US infrastructure.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Biden laid out his Big Gulp idea: a \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-03-30/biden-to-lay-out-u-s-economic-renewal-in-rejuvenated-pittsburgh?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$2.3 trillion plan\u003c/a\u003e to revamp the country’s roads, bridges, trains, schools, housing, electric grid, and lots more. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBtw, not sure if we mentioned this but the plan is large: The administration said it’d be the biggest federal investment program since Eisenhower’s interstate highway system of the late 1950s and the Space Race of the 1960s. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe details \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFour-part plans like these are what bullet points were made for:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e$620 billion for transportation projects such as transit, roads, airports, and more. That also includes $174 billion for electric vehicles. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e$650 billion to improve your life at home, like investments in high-speed broadband and the electric grid.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e$580 billion for manufacturing, because we know how much the supply chain needs support.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e$400 billion to caregiving efforts for the elderly and those with disabilities.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eGiven the size of the bill, the WH can’t just put its card down and Venmo everyone later. To help pay for it, Biden wants to bump up the corporate tax from 21% to 28% and close other tax loopholes.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut that’s not good enough for many Republicans, who slammed the bill as a “\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/joe-biden-technology-coronavirus-pandemic-pittsburgh-jen-psaki-8865ffc8f5ad3142155a5bd3c3a3e6d3?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eTrojan horse\u003c/a\u003e” for tax hikes.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo why do it? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBiden sees this plan as addressing two malarkies in particular: the climate crisis and the growing ambitions of autocratic China.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eFor the climate, the plan “would be the most far-reaching federal investment to date in programs that would help curb greenhouse gas emissions,” \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/biden-climate-transit-package-d9c8ffad-4486-4e61-a7bb-3d421fa0546d.html?utm_source=twitter\u0026utm_medium=social\u0026utm_campaign=editorial\u0026utm_content=energy-environment-infrastructure\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eKenneth Chenault, former CEO of American Express, and Kenneth Frazier, CEO of pharma giant Merck, \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/31/business/voting-rights-georgia-corporations.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003espearheaded\u003c/a\u003e a letter signed by 72 Black executives to oppose restrictive voting bills across the US, specifically the one \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/georgia-voting-restrictions/2021/03/25/91009e72-8da1-11eb-9423-04079921c915_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epassed\u003c/a\u003e in Georgia last Thursday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSome context: \u003c/strong\u003eAfter some Republican lawmakers alleged voter fraud during the 2020 election, bills like Georgia’s have been popping up in state and local legislatures. 250+ new voting laws have been proposed in at least 43 states, per the Brennan Center for Justice. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCritics like Chenault and Frazier warn that the proposals could make it harder for Black, Latino, and other minority populations to vote. The letter encourages corporations to speak out against the bills and use their resources to oppose them.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCivil rights activists took specific aim at Georgia-based companies that they felt were staying too quiet. Following protests and calls for a boycott, the CEOs of both Coca-Cola and Delta said they oppose the state’s new legislation.  \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“The entire rationale for this bill was based on a lie,” Delta boss Ed Bastian wrote in an internal memo.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eCompanies that proclaimed Black Lives Matter last summer are now under pressure to deliver on their statements.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSean Paul said “legalize it” and New York lawmakers replied, “We be burnin’.” Yesterday, NY Gov. Andrew Cuomo \u003ca href=\"https://patch.com/new-york/new-york-city/recreational-marijuana-ny-only-needs-cuomos-signature?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esigned legislation\u003c/a\u003e legalizing the recreational use of marijuana by adults, making New York the 15th state to do so. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eTwo takeaways from NY’s Marijuana Regulation and Taxation Act\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e1. All marijuana convictions that would not have occurred had this law existed are now expunged, or wiped from offenders’ records. It’s part one in New York’s attempt to repair, or at least throw some duct tape on, the War on Drugs’s legacy. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e40% of all cannabis-generated tax revenue will be \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/31/nyregion/cuomo-ny-legal-weed.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereinvested\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e into minority communities.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e2. The bill has provisions in place to keep the Medmens of the world from dominating mom-and-pop marijuana operations. One of those rules: Half of all marijuana business licenses will be granted to “social equity applicants,” such as minority- and woman-owned companies.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eNew York’s cannabis economy is expected to become the second-biggest US market (just after Cali), generating billions in sales and $350 million in annual tax revenue once it fully lights up. But you just have to cross the Holland Tunnel into New Jersey to see \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/22/nyregion/new-jersey-marijuana-legalization.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eit’ll be a while\u003c/a\u003e before you can buy a nug at your local bodega.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd
